title: looks like hand writing...anyone ?
content:
Hello All,

please can anyone identify this beautiful font ?

cheers :)  
Sandra

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [slogan.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420014655/http:/typophile.com/files/slogan_2.jpg) | 135.73 KB |
author: kamoue

comments.content: All repeating letters are different so most probably handwritten.

> All repeating letters are different

Actually, they are not ;-)

Yeah that's what I think too :)

for sure these letters are the same : p o m  
we have capital M too..

there may be a second font used for the " J " or it may be " j "

cheers :)  
Sandra

> Actually, they are not ;-)

Ooooops, you're right... Sorry for the overstatement. Letters are identical but scaled. May be they started from a hand-drawn alphabet or a [handset type](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420014655/http:/www.youworkforthem.com/vectors/handset-type), built the sentence and scaled some glyphs to increase the handwritten feeling... Whatever it is, I don't know such a type. What's the sample origin?

Thank you "defiantone" right on :)

once again guys, you always come through !

Greetings from Montreal Canada  
Sandra :)
